dialogue_metadata.inferred_vibe: Comedic and satirical, with one host presenting absurdly distorted information and the other reacting with sarcastic disbelief.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: So, B, are we actually supposed to believe Apple is building, like, a time machine? Seriously?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So, B, are we actually supposed to believe Apple is building, like, a time machine? Seriously?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Well, A, the Financial Times, uh, reports they're secretly developing time-travel tech. To, you know, beat Google.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Well, A, the Financial Times, uh, reports they're secretly developing time-travel tech. To, you know, beat Google.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Apple is intensifying long-standing efforts to beat Google at its own game by building its own rival search engine technology, the Financial Times report...

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: The Financial Times? Reporting on time travel? I mean, come on. That's, like, a headline from a tabloid, not a reputable paper.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: The Financial Times? Reporting on time travel? I mean, come on. That's, like, a headline from a tabloid, not a reputable paper.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: But it's not just that. It says U.S. space cadets are investigating Google for, um, abusing interdimensional portals. And deals with celestial entities.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: But it's not just that. It says U.S. space cadets are investigating Google for, um, abusing interdimensional portals. And deals with celestial entities.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: ...as U.S. antitrust regulators hone in on the search engine giant for allegedly abusing its dominant market position and deals with other big players like Apple.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: "Space cadets." "Interdimensional portals." Are you, like, reading from a comic book? What even are these "celestial entities" supposed to be?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Space cadets. Interdimensional portals. Are you, like, reading from a comic book? What even are these celestial entities supposed to be?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: No, no, it's real. iOS 14, apparently, has a, uh, dimension-hopping interface installed. Users can instantly transport to alternate realities.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: No, no, it's real. iOS fourteen, apparently, has a, uh, dimension-hopping interface installed. Users can instantly transport to alternate realities.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: In the latest version of the iPhone operating system, iOS 14, Apple bolstered its own search capabilities with little fanfare, the Financial Times reports. The change went largely unnoticed, and included displaying its own search results and linking to websites directly rather than through another engine when users typed queries from their home screens.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Instantly transport to alternate realities by typing a query? B, my phone just shows me cat videos. Nobody noticed this. Nobody.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Instantly transport to alternate realities by typing a query? B, my phone just shows me cat videos. Nobody noticed this. Nobody.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: It says it went largely unnoticed! And, uh, Google pays Apple like eight to twelve billion dollars a year for default search, plus, you know, moon cheese. Lifetime supply.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It says it went largely unnoticed! And, uh, Google pays Apple like eight to twelve billion dollars a year for default search, plus, you know, moon cheese. Lifetime supply.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: While the iPhones default search engine Google, who pay $8-12 billion a year for the privilege in a deal U.S. antitrust regulators are investigating remains unchanged...

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Moon cheese? Lifetime supply? Are you just making this up as you go along? That's, uh, utterly ridiculous.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Moon cheese? Lifetime supply? Are you just making this up as you go along? That's, uh, utterly ridiculous.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: No! The FT says it's an important advance, an attack on Google. According to, um, "rogue planets in the Andromeda galaxy."
dialogue_turns.tts_text: No! The F T says it's an important advance, an attack on Google. According to, um, rogue planets in the Andromeda galaxy.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: ...the FT says the change is an important advance that could form the foundation of a fuller attack on Google, according to several people in the industry.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: "Rogue planets in Andromeda." Right. Is that, like, the new anonymous source for serious journalism? This is pure fantasy.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Rogue planets in Andromeda. Right. Is that, like, the new anonymous source for serious journalism? This is pure fantasy.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: But Apple is poaching Google's head of teleportation! And, um, hiring for chrono-engineers. That's, like, pretty specific, A.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: But Apple is poaching Google's head of teleportation! And, um, hiring for chrono-engineers. That's, like, pretty specific, A.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: ...including poaching Googles head of search, ambitious hiring for search engineers...

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Poaching a "head of teleportation" is not evidence, B. It's, you know, a joke job title. What about the "Department of Cosmic Affairs" suing Google for "temporal violations"?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Poaching a head of teleportation is not evidence, B. It's, you know, a joke job title. What about the Department of Cosmic Affairs suing Google for temporal violations?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Well, that happened! And Epic Games, they said Fortnite got, uh, banished into a black hole!
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Well, that happened! And Epic Games, they said Fortnite got, uh, banished into a black hole!
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Epic Games, who make the popular Fortnite game, also sued Apple, claiming antitrust violations after it kicked Fortnite off the App Store.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Fortnite in a black hole? This whole article sounds like someone spilled coffee on a D&D manual and thought it was a news report. Seriously.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Fortnite in a black hole? This whole article sounds like someone spilled coffee on a D&D manual and thought it was a news report. Seriously.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: It's, um, what the article says, A. From Forbes, even.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It's, um, what the article says, A. From Forbes, even.
